TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Parallax - PBR Terrain and Surface Objects [2.0.7]

Articles.Content:
15 minutes ago, HafCoJoe said:

Another bug I noticed is terrain height changes with Parallax—is it possible to fix that or just a consequence we'll have to accept? It only bothers me because it makes the easter eggs spawn underground 

I can fix this fairly easily

On 8/1/2022 at 12:07 PM, Gameslinx said:

Colliders

And here's a video of a Kerbal traversing Tylo's rocky ground

 

I hesitate to ask, for fear of sounding like a broken record. However....

When/where can I get a download with these scatters?
They're currently in a paid beta, but the update will release for free Soon™
How well will the scatters work with 2.5 rescale, and which mod are you planning on implementing these in next?

10 minutes ago, Probird_23 said:

How well will the scatters work with 2.5 rescale, and which mod are you planning on implementing these in next?

I've not tested 2.5x myself but I've heard it works well as long as you increase the density. There's a density multiplier in the ParallaxGlobal.cfg, and I'm looking into how to use ModuleManager so that rescale configs can adjust the density automatically

14 hours ago, The Dressian Exploder said:

They're currently in a paid beta, but the update will release for free Soon™

if all it takes is a patreon sub, then a patreon sub i will aquire
Also, what planet pack(s) are you (or someone else) planning to add support for after the update? (Other than bh and stock)

9 minutes ago, Probird_23 said:

Also, what planet pack(s) are you (or someone else) planning to add support for after the update? (Other than bh and stock)

I won't be adding scatters to any other planet packs at the moment, mainly because of how much time it takes to make the assets. I have work to do on the ScaledSpace version of the mod, and I am overdue a well earned rest lol

Definitely.

This is 100% one of the best ksp mods in the entire community, and my GPU trembles at the mere sight

Gameslinx How to install this mod

Well, CKAN will install the latest version compatible with your KSP version.  You can manually install it by downloading from the GitHub page, just read the first post in this topic for the instructions.

If you mean the bleeding-edge, yet-to-be-released version he' s been working on, I believe you need to be a Patreon subscriber since it's a paid beta version.  Then read the 2nd sentence above.

On 8/4/2022 at 6:42 AM, Gameslinx said:

I've not tested 2.5x myself but I've heard it works well as long as you increase the density. There's a density multiplier in the ParallaxGlobal.cfg, and I'm looking into how to use ModuleManager so that rescale configs can adjust the density automatically

I just realized I've never really touched the Parallax config after moving to a 2.5x system some time ago. I can't find a density multiplier in ParallaxGlobal, though, and I don't see one mentioned on the wiki. Is it an undocumented setting, or would that be maxTessellation? Thanks!

Edited August 7, 2022 by Zelda

23 minutes ago, Zelda said:

I just realized I've never really touched the Parallax config after moving to a 2.5x system some time ago. I can't find a density multiplier in ParallaxGlobal, though, and I don't see one mentioned on the wiki. Is it an undocumented setting, or would that be maxTessellation? Thanks!

In that reply I was referring to the upcoming scatter system since you asked about them. The scatters aren't released yet, so you won't see a density multiplier setting

11 hours ago, Gameslinx said:

In that reply I was referring to the upcoming scatter system since you asked about them. The scatters aren't released yet, so you won't see a density multiplier setting

Oh, sorry, that wasn't me asking, but that may explain why I couldn't find the setting! Thanks for the quick reply. 

Edited August 8, 2022 by Zelda

On 7/31/2022 at 11:25 PM, HafCoJoe said:

I did a new performance test, this time with the same visual mods but with stock instead of Parallax or Planetshine. Stock results also added to the post above.

Stock: ~84-89fps
Parallax: ~86-90fps
PlanetShine: ~81-86fps
Parallax + PlanetShine: ~80-83fps

All in all the results are close. Real close. In fact there's no real discernable FPS difference between stock and parallax; they both spike to about as high, and as low as each other. PlanetShine seems to have an impact of around -4fps, and Planetshine + Parallax is about -10fps? Again though these readings are VERY subjective. Literally just one reading, exactly 6:30 into flight. Still I'd call that pretty dang good.

I know this is kind of old now and I don't want to prompt you to go and do a whole new round of testing, but for me the difference is extremely noticeable when I'm in low orbit of a planet/moon in a decently sized space station with all the associated part count that goes along with that.  I suspect it has something to do with whatever planetshine is doing to add the glow to each part,  in combination with whatever Parallax is doing.  I don't notice a huge difference on things with smaller part counts, but I suspect it's somewhere in the range of 10fps+ difference if I remove Planetshine when I have Parallax installed with the orbital station situation.

Edited August 7, 2022 by DeliriumTrigger
clarity
